title: COVID-19 Vaccine
cleaned_text: COVID-19 Vaccine See Vaccine information in [Spanish / Español ](/covid19/vaccine/index-es.html). Content verified September 1, 2023 See available County-run clinics. Make an appointment online, or drop in without an appointment. [See clinic dates & times | Make an appointment](/covid19/vaccine/vaccine-clinics.html) |For this age group||Select this vaccine| |Age 12 and older||Moderna, Novavax, or Pfizer| If you need help making an appointment at a County-run clinic, or have COVID-19 questions, please call 240-777-1050. If there is no answer, leave a message, and we will return your call promptly. To find more COVID-19 vaccine locations near you, including Novavax vaccine: [Search vaccines.gov](https://www.vaccines.gov/), text your ZIP code to 438829, or call 1-800-232-0233 (TTY 1-888-720-7489). For veterans enrolled in VA Healthcare: [Washington DC VA Medical Center](https://www.va.gov/washington-dc-health-care/) | [Martinsburg VA minors come applies| |with their parent / guardian|| | |age 12 to 17 without their parent / guardian|| | Get a copy of your vaccination record For an online record of your COVID-19 vaccination, [view your account in Maryland MyIR](https://myirmobile.com/maryland-sign-in/). MyIR is Maryland's online immunization record system. It is considered your official record of vaccination. If you have trouble accessing your online record, [use the MyIR Help](https://myirmobile.com/help/). If your record does not show up on MyIR, [request help for an "unmatched record"](https://health.maryland.gov/phpa/OIDEOR/IMMUN/Pages/rrf.aspx). You can also contact your doctor for help. We cannot provide duplicate CDC vaccination cards.
